theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: The current model captures some aspects of legitimate peripheral participation through contributor progression, but misses key concepts like boundary objects, mutual engagement, and shared repertoire that are essential to Communities of Practice theory. Adding these elements will better represent how newcomers become integrated into the community through participation in shared practices and artifacts.

variables.name: Community Shared Repertoire
variables.description: Accumulated shared resources, routines, vocabulary, and tools that the community develops together

variables.name: Mutual Engagement Level
variables.description: Degree of collaborative interaction and relationship building among community members

variables.name: Boundary Objects Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of artifacts that enable coordination between different participant groups

variables.name: Legitimate Peripheral Participation Rate
variables.description: Rate at which newcomers engage in authentic but low-risk community activities

variables.name: Shared Practice Development
variables.description: Rate at which community develops new shared practices and routines

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: While the model has implicit and explicit knowledge stocks, it doesn't fully capture the four knowledge conversion processes (Socialization, Externalization, Combination, Internalization) that drive the knowledge spiral. Adding these specific conversion mechanisms will better represent how knowledge is created and transformed within the open source community context.

variables.name: Socialization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of sharing tacit knowledge through shared experiences and observation

variables.name: Externalization Rate
variables.description: Rate at which tacit knowledge is articulated into explicit concepts

variables.name: Combination Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of systemizing and applying explicit knowledge

variables.name: Internalization Rate
variables.description: Rate at which explicit knowledge is absorbed and becomes tacit understanding

variables.name: Ba Quality
variables.description: Quality of the shared context for knowledge creation and sharing

variables.name: Knowledge Conversion Rate
variables.description: Renamed to better represent Externalization process (tacit to explicit knowledge conversion)

variables.name: Explicit to Implicit Conversion
variables.description: Renamed to better represent Internalization process (explicit to tacit knowledge conversion)
